name: Simon Poh
description: Contributor to CNA, Asia's leading English-language news platform.

articles.title: Commentary: Taxing the wealthy makes sense when there is little room for higher income tax or GST
articles.subtitle: Moves to increase taxes on high-end properties and luxury cars in Budget 2023 come hot on the heels of similar moves just last year, but that isn’t surprising, says NUS professor Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: Singapore must send a bold signal to attract global talent
articles.subtitle: Singapore ranks highly in global talent competitiveness, but we cannot rest on our laurels, says NUS Business School’s Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: Is Singapore’s tax burden shifting toward GST and taxing individuals more than businesses?
articles.subtitle: The planned GST hike could add S$3.2 billion more in tax revenue, but Singapore needs a sustainable tax system to fund healthcare and other recurrent costs in the long run, says NUS Business School’s Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: Why different GST rates for luxury and essential goods don't make much difference for Singapore
articles.subtitle: With a GST hike anticipated amid concerns about cost of living, Simon Poh from NUS Business School discusses whether differentiating essential items and discretionary spending will lessen the impact on Singaporeans.

articles.title: Commentary: Property stamp duties and inheritance – could wealth taxes in Singapore come from these?
articles.subtitle: Careful attention must be paid to ensure the broad-based middle class do not end up bearing the bill, says NUS Business School Professor Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: The global minimum corporate tax rate is coming our way and will change how Singapore attracts MNCs
articles.subtitle: A more realistic global minimum corporate tax rate of 15 per cent may bring it closer to global acceptance and soften its negative impact on Singapore, but it would still require the country to rethink incentives for large MNCs, says NUS Business School’s Assoc Prof Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: US proposed global minimum corporate tax has implications for Singapore
articles.subtitle: Joe Biden’s move to raise taxes may be well-timed, given domestic demands for government expenditure and a growing global acceptance that corporate taxes must be raised. But this has implications for Singapore, says NUS Business School’s Assoc Prof Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: Budget 2021 and how Singapore’s tax system is changing for the better
articles.subtitle: Amid Singapore’s challenging fiscal position, tweaks to some taxes may be needed but the bigger shift to tap on private monies may be the ultimate game-changer, if relevant safeguards are in place, says NUS’ Associate Professor Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: GST hike unavoidable, will probably take place in 2023
articles.subtitle: A GST hike has been on the cards for some time. We should also expect further tax increases, possibly stamp duty increases, after the pandemic blows over, says Simon Poh.

articles.title: Commentary: Who cares if US President Donald Trump pays only US$750 in taxes?
articles.subtitle: On the back of news of Trump's tax returns last week, NUS Business School Professor Simon Poh discusses why paying taxes matter.
